item.title: G-MODE Archives+ Armored Core: Mobile 3 announced for Switch, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch

Release date not announced.

G-MODE will release FromSoftware-developed game Armored Core: Mobile 3 as a G-MODE Archives+ title for Switch via Nintendo eShop and PC via Steam in Japan, the company announced. A release date was not announced.

Armored Core: Mobile 3 is an action game that originally launched for feature phones on January 25, 2007 in Japan.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Fight on—just to survive. A world of rival powers, with tomorrow unknown.

  • 3D mech action game.
  • Progress through stages by completing each mission.
  • A variety of battle scenarios and mission types.
  • Customize your machine’s parts to change your battle style.
  • An exclusive story only available in this title.
  • A port of a Japanese flip phone title (feature phones popular before smartphones). This release does not add elements such as languages and achievements that were not part of the original version.

Series Overview

A port of the classic title originally released in 2007 for feature phones, part of FromSoftware acclaimed 3D mech action series, Armored Core.

The story’s timeline fills in the gap between the console versions Armored Core Nexus and Armored Core Last Raven.

Game System

Progress the story by completing each mission.

Choose parts for each section of your machine to build your own customized unit.

Then take on the operation objectives set for each mission.

Aim for high-rated mission completions to achieve the top “Raven Rank – S.”

Carry out operations across various scenarios, including assaults and defenses, in urban areas and open wastelands.

Dare to battle through fast-paced mech action combat?



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/g-mode-archives-armored-core-mobile-3-announced-for-switch-pc

item.title: Inazuma Eleven ‘INA-DAI’ live stream set for January 13, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

The latest updates on Inazuma Eleven.

LEVEL-5 will host the Inazuma Eleven news live stream “INA-DAI” on January 13, 2026  at 4:00 a.m. PT / 7:00 a.m. ET / 21:00 JST, the company announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube.

The broadcast will share the latest updates on Inazuma Eleven, including “first-time reveals.”

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam. Inazuma Eleven RE, a remake of the original Inazuma Eleven, is due out for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2026.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/inazuma-eleven-ina-dai-live-stream-set-for-january-13-2026

item.title: Melty Blood: Type Lumina shipments and digital sales top 600,000
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • Switch
  • Xbox One

100,000 units sold since June 2024.

Total shipments and digital sales for Melty Blood: Type Lumina have surpassed 600,000 units worldwide, Project Lumina announced.

The fighting game was last reported to have achieved total shipments and digital sales of 500,000 units in June 2024, meaning an additional 100,000 units have been moved since then.

Melty Blood: Type Lumina launched digitally for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 30, 2021 worldwide.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/melty-blood-type-lumina-shipments-and-digital-sales-top-600000
